com.rockhoppertech.music.chord

Class Chord

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.rockhoppertech.music.chord.Chord
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cloneable, Comparable<Chord>

    public class Chord
extends Object
implements Cloneable, Comparable<Chord>
    Models a more or less simultineity that can be created and modified using the concepts (e.g. inversion, drop voicing etc.) of a Chord.

    The ChordFactory serves as a registry and contains several factory methods.

    Each instance contains a ChordVoicing to which is delegated most operations.

    Author:
    Gene De Lisa
    See Also:
    ChordFactory, ChordVoicing, MIDITrack

      • Chord

        public Chord(String symbol,
     Integer[] intervals2,
     String description)
        Called from ChordFactoryXMLHelper if the intervals are specified in the XML file.
        Parameters:
        symbol - the Chord symbol
        intervals2 - the intervals to use
        description - the Chord's description

      • Chord

        public Chord(String symbol,
     String spelling,
     String description)
        e.g. Chord("maj", "1 3 5", "major");. Called from ChordFactoryXMLHelper only if the intervals are not in the XML file but the spelling is.
        Parameters:
        symbol - a chord symbol
        spelling - the spelling
        description - a description

      • Chord

        public Chord(Chord c)
        Copy constructor. clone() is evil.
        Parameters:
        c - the Chord to copy.

      • getChordDegree

        public final int getChordDegree(int degree)
        Return the MIDI number of the pitch that is the specified chord degree. Given 13 for a C13 chord you get back the A in the octave above the root's octave. 
         int theSeventh = chord.getChordDegree(7);
        If the chord does not contain the specified degree -1 is returned. (e.g. getChordDegree(13) for a triad).
        Parameters:
        degree - 1,3,5,7,9,11, or 13
        Returns:
        a MIDI number or -1 for an invalid degree

      • setSymbol

        public void setSymbol(String symbol)
        Tries to set this chord's intervals to a registered chord. If the symbol is not registered with the ChordFactory then this just sets the instance field.
        Parameters:
        symbol - the symbol to set e.g. maj7

      • toRoman

        public String toRoman(Scale scale,
             String key)
        Uses the RomanChordParser to get the Roman numeral for this Chord's position in the specified Scale.
        Parameters:
        scale - the Scale to use
        key - the Scale's key.
        Returns:
        a String
        See Also:
        Scale, RomanChordParser
